intro: Hieracium confertifolium, commonly known as the dense-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are basal and clustered, with a rough, hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium confertifolium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
